snippet: Authorities hope that the device, called PrePex, will help in the goal of circumcising 20 million African men by 2015 to slow the epidemic.
abstract: PrePex, a bloodless, nonsurgical circumcision device for adults, will be tested in at least nine African countries over 12 months in an effort to slow spread of AIDS.
lead_paragraph: Authorities hope that the device, called PrePex, will help in the goal of circumcising 20 million African men by 2015 to slow the epidemic.

headline.seo: Nonsurgical Circumcision Device Will Be Tested to Help Curb AIDS
headline.main: Africa: Nonsurgical Circumcision Device Will Be Tested to Help Curb AIDS
headline.print_headline: Africa: Nonsurgical Circumcision Device Will Be Tested to Help Curb AIDS

keywords.value: President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief
